keyFacts: Irene Aviles, an employee of the Metropolitan Correctional Center in Newark, applied for a Bank of America account on May 10, 2005.
The document is a financial record from the Epstein case data set, suggesting potential relevance to financial investigations.
The Metropolitan Correctional Center is a federal detention facility, indicating the applicant may have been a corrections officer or staff member.
